# Align proxy pills and update styles (2025-10-12 15:50-0400)

_**User (2025-10-12 03:22-0400)**_

read my conversation with chatgot about @closet-screen.html and hten plan:
ok look at closet-screen.html in the freestyle github repo. i switched the triple bar equal sign to svg but it still doesnt feel aligned with the number next to it...also i want the upper right pills (lets justt call them proxy pills, upper left are size pills) to have the look and feel of the brand. maybe either copy the filter pill format ('all' etc) or something similar
ChatGPT said:
Thought for 18s

Got it—let’s make the proxy pills look on-brand and perfectly aligned.

Below is a drop-in HTML + CSS you can paste into freestyle-october/assets/iframe/closet-screen.html (and your CSS block there) to:

align the ≡ icon vertically with the number

style the “proxy pills” (top-right) to match your filter pills (“All / Tops / …”)

keep the size pills (top-left) unchanged

1) HTML (inside each card)

Replace your current proxy badge markup with this:

<button class="proxy-pill" aria-label="2 proxies: people who own this in your size">
  <span class="icon" aria-hidden="true">
    <!-- ≡ icon as SVG -->
    <svg viewBox="0 0 24 24" role="img" focusable="false" aria-hidden="true">
      <path d="M4 7h16M4 12h16M4 17h16" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round"/>
    </svg>
  </span>
  <span class="count">2</span>
</button>


Place it absolutely in the upper-right corner (same spot you use now).

2) CSS (same file, <style> block)

Add these styles (they mimic your filter pill look while aligning the SVG + number):

/* ---- proxy pill (upper-right) ---- */
.proxy-pill {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;              /* adjust as needed to match your card radius */
  right: 10px;
  display: inline-flex;   /* keeps icon + number aligned */
  align-items: center;
  gap: 6px;
  padding: 6px 10px;
  height: 28px;           /* same visual height as your filter pills */
  border-radius: 9999px;
  font: 600 13px/1 var(--font-ui, system-ui, -apple-system, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif);
  letter-spacing: .01em;
  color: var(--pill-fg, #1f2a37);
  background: var(--pill-bg, #fff);
  box-shadow:
    0 1px 2px rgba(16, 24, 40, .06),
    0 1px 1px rgba(16, 24, 40, .04),
    inset 0 0 0 1px rgba(16, 24, 40, .06);  /* subtle ring like your pills */
  -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
  text-shadow: none;
  cursor: default;
  user-select: none;
}

/* brand tint (optional): use same gradient/ring that the active filter pill uses */
@media (prefers-color-scheme: light) {
  .proxy-pill {
    background: var(--surface, #fff);
  }
}
@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) {
  .proxy-pill {
    background: rgba(255,255,255,.08);
    color: #fff;
    box-shadow: inset 0 0 0 1px rgba(255,255,255,.18);
  }
}

/* exact centering of the ≡ SVG with the numeral */
.proxy-pill .icon {
  display: block;
  width: 1.05em;          /* scales with text size */
  height: 1.05em;
  line-height: 1;         /* no extra inline space */
}
.proxy-pill .icon svg {
  display: block;         /* removes inline-svg baseline dip */
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  vertical-align: middle; /* belts-and-suspenders */
}

/* Numeral alignment and legibility */
.proxy-pill .count {
  line-height: 1;                     /* matches the icon’s block fit */
  font-feature-settings: "tnum" 1;    /* tabular lining for crisp numerals */
}

/* Hover/active polish (if you ever want it clickable) */
.proxy-pill:active {
  transform: translateY(0.5px);
}


If you already have variables like --mint-200/--mint-300 for pills, you can set
--pill-bg and --pill-fg at :root or on .proxy-pill to re-use them.

         document.querySelector('#proxy-sheet')?.removeAttribute('hidden');

       if(e.target.matches('.sheet, .sheet-close')){
         const isBackdrop = e.target.classList.contains('sheet');

_**User (2025-10-12 03:47-0400)**_

Quick design notes

Legend copy & hierarchy

Current: “Proxies – users who wear this item in your size”

Better (clear + concise): “≡ Proxies — people who own this in your size.”

Make Proxies semi-bold, the rest regular. Keep it on one line and compact.

Legend spacing

Tighten vertical rhythm so it hugs the title but doesn’t crowd the grid:

margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 10px;

Keep the mint dot (nice touch), but reduce its weight:

size 8px, subtle glow box-shadow: 0 0 0 2px rgba(102,227,212,.18).

Proxy pill alignment & brand feel

The new rounded pills look good; make them a tad smaller and unify with your filter pills:

height: 28px, padding: 0 8px, border-radius: 9999px

background: rgba(var(--mint-rgb), .12) (or #E9FBF8)

border: 1px solid var(--mint-200)

font: 600 13px

Ensure the ≡ and number are perfectly centered on the baseline:

Use display:inline-flex; align-items:center; gap:4px; line-height:1;

Nudge the icon down by 0.5px (transform: translateY(.5px)) for optical balance.

Keep stroke consistent with your icon set: stroke-width: 2, stroke: currentColor.

Size pills (top-left)

Good contrast. Consider monospace numerals for multi-locale sizes (UK 8 / 26S / M) so width changes don’t jitter the layout.

Make sure both pills share the same elevation & border rules for cohesion.

Micro-onboarding

Add a tiny helper: “What’s a proxy?” chip at the end of the legend that opens your sheet. It teaches first-time users without clutter.

<p class="legend" role="note">

      <!-- 12x8 viewBox gives us a clean 3-bar icon aligned to text -->

CSS

.legend{
  display:flex; align-items:baseline; gap:.5rem;
  font-size: clamp(13px, 1.7vw, 16px);
  line-height: 1.35;
  color:#6A7A87;
}
.legend-term{ 
  font-weight: 700; 
  display:inline-flex; 
  align-items:baseline; 
  gap:.35rem; 
  color:#34424D;

/* Icon sizing & baseline nudge */
.equiv{
  display:inline-block;
  width: 1.05em;          /* ~ same width as a character */
  height: .70em;          /* slightly below x-height */
  vertical-align: -0.12em;/* optical baseline */
  transform: translateY(.02em); /* tiny tweak to taste */
  color: #29D3C8;         /* brand mint */
}
.equiv svg{
  display:block; width:100%; height:100%; fill: currentColor;
}

.legend-def{ color:#6A7A87; font-weight:500; }


The key is align-items: baseline on the row and a tiny vertical-align/translateY on the icon. The SVG’s viewBox is short (8) so the three bars sit within the text’s x-height and won’t look tall.

_**User (2025-10-12 03:47-0400)**_

what do you think of this?
Here’s how I’d polish it so it feels “product-grade” and consistent with your brand.

What to change (high-level)

Keep the legend inline, not indented. It should sit directly under “Your Closet,” left-aligned with the H1. Use hierarchy (weight + color), not indentation, to signal it’s a subline.

Typographic hierarchy

“Proxies” = semibold, primary text color.

“— users who share your size” = regular, muted text color.

The ≡ glyph = the only element in brand color (accent), same cap-height as text.

Spacing

4–6px between the H1 and the legend.

12–16px between the legend and the first row of cards.

Proxy pill (top-right on cards)

Use a subtle mint-50 background, mint-200 border, and mint-600 icon/number.

Make the icon baseline-aligned with the number (inline-flex fixes this).

Size: 24px height, 10–12px text, 6–8px side padding.

Drop-in CSS (add to your closet-screen.html style block or the shared CSS)
/* ---- Legend under H1 ---- */
.legend-row {
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
  gap: 8px;                /* space between pieces */
  margin-top: 6px;         /* space under H1 */
  color: var(--ink-600);   /* muted body */
  font-size: 15px;
  line-height: 20px;
}

.legend-row .legend-label {
  font-weight: 600;
  color: var(--ink-900);   /* primary text for "Proxies" */
}

.legend-row .legend-glyph {
  display: inline-flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  width: 16px;
  height: 16px;
  color: var(--mint-600);  /* brand accent for ≡ */
  /* keep it optically centered with text */
  transform: translateY(0.5px);
}

/* space before the grid */
.legend-row + .grid {
  margin-top: 14px;
}

/* ---- Proxy pill on cards (top-right) ---- */
.proxy-pill {
  display: inline-flex;
  align-items: center;
  gap: 4px;
  height: 24px;
  padding: 0 8px;
  border-radius: 9999px;
  background: var(--mint-50);
  border: 1px solid var(--mint-200);
  color: var(--mint-700);
  font-weight: 600;
  font-size: 12px;
  line-height: 16px;
  box-shadow: 0 1px 0 rgba(16,24,40,0.03); /* subtle lift */
}

.proxy-pill .equiv {
  display: inline-flex;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  width: 12px;
  height: 12px;
  color: var(--mint-600);
  /* perfect baseline alignment with the number */
  transform: translateY(0.5px);
}

/* if you need a tighter mobile option */
@media (max-width: 390px) {
  .proxy-pill { height: 22px; font-size: 11px; padding: 0 7px; }
  .proxy-pill .equiv { width: 11px; height: 11px; }
}

Minimal HTML tweaks

Legend line (under “Your Closet”):

<div class="legend-row" role="note" aria-label="Proxies legend">
  <span class="legend-label">Proxies</span>
  <span class="legend-glyph" aria-hidden="true">≡</span>
  <span>users who share your size</span>
</div>


Proxy pill on a card:

<button class="proxy-pill" aria-label="2 proxies for this item">
  <span class="equiv" aria-hidden="true">≡</span>
  <span>2</span>
</button>

Why this will look better

Alignment & rhythm: Inline-flex on both the legend glyph and pill content keeps the ≡ perfectly baseline-aligned with text.

Clear hierarchy: Only “Proxies” is strong; the explanatory clause is muted, so the eye catches the keyword and moves on.

Brand consistency: The accent color appears on functional affordances (≡ and pills) without overpowering the layout.

_**User (2025-10-12 03:47-0400)**_

ok lets actualy change the faq section to these:

What is a “proxi”?
A proxi is a real person who owns the same item in the same size as you. We surface their photos and sizes so you can shop “by proxi” with confidence.

How does Proxi know who’s my proxi?
When you add an item to your Closet, we match the brand, item and size. If someone else has that exact combo, they become your proxi for that piece. 

Do I have to upload photos?
No. Photos help others, but they’re optional. Adding items + sizes is enough to get proxi matches and size guidance.

How many items do I need to start?
Just one. Add a single piece you already own and you’ll see proxi matches and recommended sizes on similar items right away. More items = better matches.

What does the ≡ number mean?
The ≡ badge shows how many proxies exist for that item in your size (e.g., “≡ 3” = three people you can learn from).

What if there aren’t proxies yet?
You’ll still get recommendations based on your Closet, as well as garment specs and brand size guides. As the community grows, new proxies appear automatically.

Are my sizes public?
Yes, but with a caveat. Item sizes you share are visible only to your proxies, aka people who share that exact same item and size. 

How is my data used?
Only to match you with proxies and improve recommendations. We don’t sell personal data. You can delete your Closet and account at any time.

Is Proxi free?
Yes. Proxi is free for shoppers. Brands may participate to feature items, but your experience stays community-first.
